Key Match Events: Jake Rogers scored when Jared Shuster was charged with a wild pitch
Greene put Detroit ahead 3-1 with a double in the seventh
Pre-Game Insights: The Tigers clinched a spot in the playoffs with a 4-1 win over the Chicago White Sox

Since Aug. 11, when Detroit was eight games under.500 and counted out of contention, it has been the hottest team in the majors with 31 wins in 42 games with the lowest ERA in baseball and the largest run differential
AL Cy Young Award favorite Tarik Skubal leads Detroit's rotation and Jason Foley has become a reliable closer in a strong bullpen
Riley Greene, an All-Star outfielder, is the team's top player in a lineup that gets timely hitting from the top to the bottom
Post-Match Reflections: The Motor City's baseball team salvaged the season and revived interest, drawing big crowds after closing recent seasons in a mostly empty ballpark
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers have been on a tear, winning six straight and 10 of 11 to surge into the playoffs and eliminate the defending AL Central champion Minnesota Twins from the race
The White Sox set a modern major league record with their 121st loss
